DataElement.preferredDefinition: The category (measurable or evaluable-only) related to the type of disease response to be followed for a patient to be evaluated at baseline and during follow up evaluations while on protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining the type of disease response to be followed for a patient to be evaluated at baseline and during follow up evaluations while on protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Property.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may refer to eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:The act or process of following a person, animal, or object through space or time.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
The act or process of following a person, animal, or object through space or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for COG MediData Rave protocol

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Measurement; the size or magnitude of something._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.

PermissibleValues.value: No evaluable disease found with imaging
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Imaging Technique Identification Negation Evaluable Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Imaging Technique Identification Negation Evaluable Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.: The procedure of having an identity established.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
The procedure of having an identity established.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.

PermissibleValues.value: Disease is evaluable but not measurable

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Specifies whether an entity is measurable.

Concepts.definition: Disease that cannot be measured directly by the size of the tumor but can be evaluated by other methods specific to a particular clinical trial.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Specifies whether an entity is measurable.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
